Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.gordienko.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.gordienko.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Impler, JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements Impler, JarImpler
Simple implementor of given interfaces from args.
Author:
Konstantin Gordienko

      private void writeToFile(Path root, String packageName, String classImplName) throws ImplerException
      Writes interface/class implementation to the file
      Parameters:
      root - root directory
      packageName - package to write to
      classImplName - name of file with implemented class
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if error occurred while writing to file

    • getPackage

      private String getPackage(Class<?> token)
      Returns package of the specified class
      Parameters:
      token - class/interface for which the package name should be determined
      Returns:
      an empty String if no package information is found, otherwise the package name

    • resolveFile

      private Path resolveFile(String packageName, Path currentPath, String fileName, String type)
      Resolves the file path for a given class or interface.
      Parameters:
      packageName - the package name of the file (empty if the file is in the default package)
      currentPath - the current directory path
      fileName - the name of the class or interface
      type - the file extension or suffix (".java", ".class", ...)
      Returns:
      resolved Path

    • writeToJar

      private void writeToJar(String packageName, String entryFileName, Path jarFile, Path fileToWrite, Manifest manifest) throws ImplerException
      Writes a new entry to a .jar file, containing specified file
      Parameters:
      packageName - the package name of the file (empty if the file is in the default package)
      entryFileName - name of the file being written
      jarFile - Path to the target .jar file
      fileToWrite - Path to source file being written to target .jar file
      manifest - Manifest for .jar file
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if error occurred while writing to .jar file

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Produces code implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name is the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added.

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if:
      • token is null.
      • root is null.
      • token is not an interface.
      • token is a private interface.
      • An I/O error occurs while writing the implementation.

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> token, Path jarFile) throws ImplerException
      Produces .jar file implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name is the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added.

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - the interface type to generate an implementation for.
      jarFile - the path to the .jar file where the compiled implementation will be saved.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if:
      • token is null.
      • jarFile is null.
      • token is not an interface.
      • token is a private interface.
      • An error occurs while compiling the implementation.
      • An I/O error occurs while creating the .jar file.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method used to run this Implementor with custom arguments.
      Possible arguments:
      • "{full-interface-or-class-name}" – the fully qualified name of the interface or class to implement.
      • -jar {full-interface-or-class-name} {file}.jar – specifies that the provided interface or class should be implemented and packaged into the specified .jar file.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments:
      • If one argument is provided, it should be the fully qualified name of the interface or class.
      • If three arguments are provided, the first must be "-jar", followed by the class/interface name and the output .jar file path.
